title: PSA: Keep enemy wards out of the Dragon/Baron Pit...or else!
body:
http://i.gyazo.com/06b041f8e9e9c25f8db396d127b195fa.gif

Can't tell you how many times I've taken the Dragon with a simple Tidal Wave/Aqua Prison combo because the enemy didn't drop a Pink and/or Sweeper to keep my wards out of the pit. (In this steal Amumu Smited early as well. Watch the health!)

Don't be cheap, use a Pink! Hell, they could even see me sitting there. There's another lesson to be had for it; if you're going to put vision behind the pit, don't ignore what you see. Kill them, prepare some CC, or pull the Dragon (not Baron of course) out of reach of medium range attacks.

*P.S. We lost the match anyway lol. Still had a good time though.*

replies.body: or have a jungler that knows when to get dragon and how to press F
No wonder I suck at objective control! I always Smite with D!

F IS FOR FLASH

D IS FOR DECIMATE

F1 IS FOR FLASH

F2 IS FOR TOO TIRED

I use keybound mouse thumb buttons :3

Are you peanut butter? 'Cause I'm jelly :P

I want a fancy gaming mouse :c

You can get really cheap ones with thumb buttons by now. It doesn't have to be a 120$ Razer.

Browse Newegg. I decided to just now to look, and see that they have mice so cheap the standard shipping is more expensive.

Except I don't put my Flash on F.

I play Shaco with the SMITE AND IGNITE! >:3

F IS FOR FIRE
D IS FOR DECIMATE

NO F IS FOR FUCK SHIT UP AND D IS FOR DODGE!!!

This video shows me nothing but the need to nerf Nami.
..because her ultimate did at least 63 damage to kill the dragon..? I dont see the logic in how this correlates to the "need to nerf Nami"..
Lmao, I'm amazed at how many people didn't realize this was a joke.
I think most likely they noticed, but were not amused, and after 1 or 2 downvotes it became herd mentality.

Dat steal.

Smite and ward mechanics are incredibly important. 

The absolute most BM steal is just autoattacking the dragon once... as a support. But using an ult is much more safe and flashy!

lmao, I've seen a Cait net-steal it.

i stopped counting the blind tornado steals with Janna too.

dat 60 dmg skill.

> The absolute most BM steal is just autoattacking the dragon once... as a support.

done that as thresh.
I mean, he's got his E passive... eh, I count it. Very bm.
and got out alive.
That's some retarded smite rofl

Reminds me of a time I not only stole drag with Braum's ult, but I also killed their jungler (a Yi) in the process. Didn't have wards either, so it was _mostly_ blind. I'm not sure why, but I fell the best part was it was completely intentional sending the ult into the pit as opposed to holding it for the inevitable teamfight (we won that too, actually).

Most triumphant recall of my life.
I just played a game where my 0/11 jinx stole the drag with her w, it wasn't warded. She ended that game 14/12....
The only excuse to not do this is when you don't have a pink ward or sweeper up. In which case, you probably shouldn't do Baron for sure and Dragon maybe.

There was once a match where the enemy jungler lost dragon once due to trying to solo it early, and I picked it up immediately when I saw the execution. Then I stole/suicude smited dragon FOUR TIMES later in the match. It was hilarious how angry he kept getting.
Well being 100% honest, that jungle smited too early. If he waited until it would do enough to kill on its own, Nami would not have gotten that.

I was being honest about it.

>  (In this steal Amumu Smited early as well. Watch the health!)
Oh I failed to read the post. Woops!
NIce lol. I pride myself with the ability to both secure and steal dragon/baron,
